summary: Process Engineering Technician with extensive experience in pharmaceutical process development, manufacturing, cGMP compliance, lean production, and project leadership; skilled in process improvement, data analysis, budgeting, and staff supervision.

experience.title: Process Engineering Technician III
experience.description: Responsible for an engineering/supervisory position to provide technical support in a poultry production industry site, including staffing, equipment cost analysis, budget estimation, establishment of a computer-based archive, and lean production program.

experience.title: Process Engineering Technician III
experience.description: Engineering technician in the process-engineering arm of the Oral Products R&D group at ALZA Corporation; hands-on experience in pharmaceutical unit operations (milling, blending, fluid bed granulation, coating, laser drilling, drying); participated in product development, scale-up experiments, and manufacturing of clinical and registration stability supplies; participated in early formulation development studies as well as late stage large scale pre-validation lots, participated in manufacturing clinical batches with strict cGMP compliance; performed related tasks including ordering materials, setting up equipment, and documentation; trained operators; in-process testing and other characterization testing; authored multiple protocols and reports; completed experimental and clinical batches in the commercial manufacturing facility at Vacaville as part of the satellite R&D group; assignments involved communication with QA, formulation, analytical and pilot plant manufacturing groups.

experience.title: Process Engineer and Manufacturing Staff
experience.description: Assisted in process development and commercial manufacturing of transdermal products; utilized existing and modified equipment in mixing, coating/laminating and pouching; revised manufacturing documentation such as SOPs and WI.

experience.title: Production Lead / Process Operator
experience.description: Supervised manufacturing group and operated various equipment for producing transdermal contraceptive products in compliance with cGMP; participated in process development and process excellence projects; operated multi-coater/dryer lamination machines; tasks included troubleshooting, training, and ensuring proper documentation; managed shift production planning and time management; participated in process improvement and waste reduction projects.

experience.title: Oil and Natural Gas Research Institute â€“ Drilling/Analysis
experience.company: Oil and Natural Gas Research Institute
experience.description: Worked on drilling and production platforms; analyzed sedimentary layers by shallow coring; prepared technical reports on laboratory results; involved in exploratory drilling site in northern Anatolia; analyzed wastewater and handled hazardous materials, producing graphs and related charts.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science: Petrochemical and Natural Gas Engineering
Off Shore Drilling and Production (Submersible Mobil platforms)
Various courses in biology and medical science (towards a degree in medicine)

certifications: How to Be a Better Communicator (Skill Path)
Excelling at Managing and Supervising (Skill Path)
